Update for spectators at athletic competitions this year. These plans were created in compliance with guidelines from Governor Mike DeWine, OHSAA, and OHC.

▪️Spectators are required to check for COVID symptoms prior to coming to a game or competition.
▪️ Spectators are required to wear face masks and practice social distancing while on school grounds for athletic competitions.
▪️ Families of rostered players will receive a code to buy a set number of tickets that will not exceed capacity.
▪️Admission is $7 for Varsity or JV and Varsity and $5 for JV stand-alone games and 7th- and 8th-grade athletics.
▪️ Passes will not be accepted at any home games, per conference rules.
▪️ Re-entry is not permitted.
▪️ Tickets can be purchased in advance online at http://bit.ly/GreenonKnightsTickets to ensure we do not exceed capacity.

The Greenon Local School District Board of Education will meet in executive session in a special board meeting on Tuesday, May 19, 2020, to determine next steps following Superintendent Brad Silvus's acceptance of a position in another district.
"We would like to thank Mr. Silvus for his service and dedication to Greenon during his time here and wish him the best on the next step of his journey," said Board President Dennis Henry. "The Board of Education will meet in executive session on May 19 to determine the best path forward in selecting our next superintendent."
Mr. Silvus, who joined the district in 2015, has accepted the role of superintendent at Graham Local Schools.
For additional information, please visit our website at http://ow.ly/pWRR50zFJbo.
.

Dayton Dragons Professional Baseball Team
April 6 at 12:05 PM ·

Every Monday on Dragons social media, we will be featuring a Dragons MVP Program winner's story. This week’s #MVPMonday recognizes Cody P. from Indian Valley Intermediate School!

Cody is in the 5th grade and enjoys the challenge that every subject in school presents. When he grows up, Cody wants to be a veterinarian so he can help animals in need. Aside from horseback riding, Cody enjoys teaching his Australian Shepherd how to do tricks including “up”, “down”, “twist”, “go backward”, and “come forward”. When asked what he can’t live without, Cody said, “My family because they are always there. Greenon Lemelson-MIT InvenTeam
February 5 at 11:44 AM ·

Community assist needed (2 Items)- An industrial sewing machine & a machine capable of putting a logo onto a tarp. Please read below for details:

1) Does anyone have access to an industrial sewing machine? While our current plan is to thermal bond the seams of HDPE screen when we roll it into a sock, we would also like to double stitch the melted plastic seams. Additionally, we would like double stitch a section of heavy duty tarp onto the sock.

2) Does anyone have access to a machine capable of transferring our logo and product name onto a tarp? This tarp will be out in the weather, so we will need something that won’t easily wear.

Thank you!

Services for Mr. Shawn Brickles will be held this Friday evening and Saturday morning in Jamestown.

The visitation will take place from 5 to 8 p.m. on Friday, December 6, at the Jamestown Church of Christ.

All athletic activities will be cancelled for Friday so that students and staff can attend. We will also provide a bus to help transport students who would like to attend the visitation. The bus will leave Greenon High School at 4:30 p.m. Friday and return between 6:30 to 7 p.m. Students can sign up tomorrow in the high school office to take the bus to the service.

The funeral service will begin at 10 a.m. on Saturday, December 7, at the Powers-Kell Funeral Home. All athletic activities for Saturday are cancelled to allow students and staff the opportunity to attend.

Condolences for Mr. Brickles' family can be left on the Powers-Kell website.

We would like to thank our students, staff, families, and community for their support and compassion for Mr. Brickles and his family, as well as his students and colleagues.

The Greenon Family is saddened to share that one of our teachers, Mr. Shawn Brickles, passed away. Counselors will be at Greenon Junior/Senior High School tomorrow, Tuesday, December 3, for any students or staff who would like to talk to someone.
Mr. Brickles has been a dedicated Intervention Specialist and Social Studies Teacher at Greenon High School for many years and has touched the lives of countless students through coaching and teaching during his 14 years at Greenon Schools. He will be deeply missed by many of our students, staff, and community members.
Please join us in extending our thoughts and prayers to Mr. Brickles' family and friends, as well as his students and colleagues.
